definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: They knew that developing iteratively was better than using a waterfall process.
sentences.chinese: 他们知道迭代开发远比使用瀑布过程要好。

sentences.english: The process is iterative, and each cycle is faster than its predecessor.
sentences.chinese: 这个过程是迭代的，每次循环都比前一个要快。

sentences.english: The max number of iterations to do when solving.
sentences.chinese: 运用高斯赛德尔迭代法的约束方程式求解器。

sentences.english: It can be called iteratively in a server thread.
sentences.chinese: 在服务器线程中可以迭代地调用它。

sentences.english: By taking a finite-time iteration of the compensation sequence, a suboptimal control law is obtained.
sentences.chinese: 取补偿项序列的有限次迭代值，获得次优控制律。
开发软件的迭代和增强。

sentences.english: This final meeting wrapped up the iteration and set us for the next day.
sentences.chinese: 这个最后的会议结束了这个迭代，迎接下一天的开始。

sentences.english: Stability of an Iterative Dual-Doppler Wind Synthesis in Cartesian Coordinates.
sentences.chinese: 笛卡尔坐标系中迭代双多普勒风合成的稳定性。

sentences.english: Other way would be to create the classes and populate the Response and iterate theough the object.
sentences.chinese: 其他方法是创建类和填充响应和迭代的对象。

sentences.english: This can be accomplished by working iteratively and incrementally.
sentences.chinese: 这是通过迭代递增地工作来实现的。

sentences.english: It can ensure unitary column orthogonality for the resulting matrix sequence.
sentences.chinese: 该方法可确保迭代矩阵列的单位列正交性。

sentences.english: A recursive method has been proposed to calculate the pair mortgage - rate.
sentences.chinese: 采用迭代方法给出了选定信用差水平下的平价抵押率。

sentences.english: The third iteration might define the intra-module pseudo-code.
sentences.chinese: 第三个迭代则定义模块内部的伪代码。

sentences.english: Each iteration begins with some planning.
sentences.chinese: 每次迭代从制定一些规划开始。

sentences.english: The actual work in terms of work items planned for this iteration.
sentences.chinese: 在为此迭代计划的工作项方面的实际工作。

definition: innovation/to bring forth new ideas/to blaze new trails
(abbr. for 嘗試錯誤|尝试错误) trial and error/failure
to escalate (in intensity)/to go up by one grade/to be promoted/to upgrade (computing)
methodology/Discours de la méthode by René Descartes 笛卡兒|笛卡儿[Di2 ka3 er2], 1637
to push out the old and bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
